title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for penalties for the unauthorized disclosure of classified information to a person not authorized to receive such information.

A bill to establish additional protections and disclosures for students and co-signers with respect to student loans, and for other purposes.
A bill to amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to provide protections for active duty military consumers.
A bill to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a study on the Veterans Crisis Line.
A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to preserve Medicare beneficiary access to ventilators, and for other purposes.

A bill to protect consumers by requiring reasonable security policies and procedures to protect data containing personal information, and to provide for nationwide notice in the event of a breach of security.

A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to establish a minimum salary threshold for bona fide executive, administrative, and professional employees exempt from Federal overtime compensation requirements, and automatically update such threshold every 3 years.
A resolution designating August 3, 2018, as "National Ernie Pyle Day".

A bill to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to provide for a special rule during the first quarter of fiscal year 2018 for the redistribution of certain Children's Health Insurance Program allocations for certain shortfall States.
A bill to provide for the resettlement and relocation of the people of Bikini.
A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to improve veterans' health care benefits, and for other purposes.
A resolution recognizing the importance and effectiveness of trauma-informed care.
Expressing support for the designation of December 3, 2017, as the "National Day of 3D Printing".
Expressing support for the use of public-private partnerships to bring computer science education to more K-12 classrooms.

Prohibiting the use of the Members' Representational Allowance of a Member of the House of Representatives to pay awards, settlements, or other compensation in connection with allegations of sexual harassment or sexual misconduct by the Member or the employees of the Member's office, and for other purposes.
Honoring the success of the more-than-a-decade-long process by Southern California locals to create the San Gabriel Mountains National Monument.
Recognizing the 150th Anniversary of Morehouse College and its contributions to the United States and the world.
To support students in completing an affordable postsecondary education that will prepare them to enter the workforce with the skills they need for lifelong success.
To expand retirement coverage, preserve retirement income, simplify rules related to retirement plans, and for other purposes.

To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to simplify the SNAP recertification process for the elderly and disabled, and to spur innovation in the application processes of SNAP, the Medicare Savings Program, and supplemental security income that will increase the utilization of entitlement programs among the most vulnerable of populations.
To prohibit deductions for settlements subject to nondisclosure agreements paid in connection with sexual harassment or sexual abuse, and for other purposes.

To amend the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 to prohibit the use of public funds for the payment of a settlement or award under such Act in connection with a claim arising from sexual harassment committed by a Member of Congress.
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit former Members of Congress from lobbying Members, officers, or employees of Congress.
To make technical amendments to certain marine fish conservation statutes, and for other purposes.
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide penalties for certain obstructions of the enforcement of Federal immigration laws.
To provide for the extension of the enforcement instruction on supervision requirements for outpatient therapeutic services in critical access and small rural hospitals through 2017.
To prohibit the use of official funds provided for the operations of a House of Congress for long-term vehicle leases, and for other purposes.

To expand the boundaries of the Bears Ears National Monument, to ensure prompt engagement with the Bears Ears Commission and prompt implementation of the Proclamation establishing the Bears Ears National Monument, and for other purposes.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the treatment of certain payments made with respect to sexual misconduct.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand retirement plan coverage, increase retirement security, and for other purposes.
To provide that the rates of pay for Members of Congress shall be reduced following any fiscal year in which there is a Federal deficit.
To prohibit the use of official funds for airline accommodations for Members of Congress which are not coach-class accommodations, and for other purposes.
To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to alter and expand eligibility for farm ownership loans by modifying the 3-year experience requirement.
To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to prepare and submit periodic reports to Congress on the role of telecommunications in hate crimes.
To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to repeal certain disclosure requirements related to resource extraction, and for other purposes.
To amend the Home Owners' Loan Act to allow mutual holding companies to clarify requirements related to the waiver of dividends, and for other purposes.

To direct the Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to make grants to States and local governments and nongovernmental organizations for purposes of carrying out shoreline stabilization projects utilizing natural materials.

To amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to provide for a special rule during the first quarter of fiscal year 2018 for the redistribution of certain Children's Health Insurance Program allocations for certain shortfall States.

To direct the Securities and Exchange Commission to revise Form S-3 so as to add listing and registration of a class of common equity securities on a national securities exchange as an additional basis for satisfying the requirements of General Instruction I.B.1. of such form and to remove such listing and registration as a requirement of General Instruction I.B.6. of such form.

Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Payday, Vehicle Title, and Certain High-Cost Installment Loans".
A resolution commemorating the 62nd anniversary of the dedication of Whiteman Air Force Base.
